1.text: Remember, O LORD, what has happened to us. Look and see our disgrace!

2.text: Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our houses to foreigners.

3.text: We have become fatherless orphans; our mothers are widows.

4.text: We must buy the water we drink; our wood comes at a price.

5.text: We are closely pursued; we are weary and find no rest.

6.text: We submitted to Egypt and Assyria to get enough bread.

7.text: Our fathers sinned and are no more, but we bear their punishment.

8.text: Slaves rule over us; there is no one to deliver us from their hands.

9.text: We get our bread at the risk of our lives because of the sword in the wilderness.

10.text: Our skin is as hot as an oven with fever from our hunger.

11.text: Women have been ravished in Zion, virgins in the cities of Judah.

12.text: Princes have been hung up by their hands; elders receive no respect.

13.text: Young men toil at millstones; boys stagger under loads of wood.

14.text: The elders have left the city gate; the young men have stopped their music.

15.text: Joy has left our hearts; our dancing has turned to mourning.

16.text: The crown has fallen from our head. Woe to us, for we have sinned!

17.text: Because of this, our hearts are faint; because of these, our eyes grow dimâ€”

18.text: because of Mount Zion, which lies desolate, patrolled by foxes.

19.text: You, O LORD, reign forever; Your throne endures from generation to generation.

20.text: Why have You forgotten us forever? Why have You forsaken us for so long?

21.text: Restore us to Yourself, O LORD, so we may return; renew our days as of old,

22.text: unless You have utterly rejected us and remain angry with us beyond measure.
